author: ethdreamer
content:
alright so to make my case here..

If the goal is to recover holesky in the same way we would recover mainnet.. then the **real** task for us here is to create social consensus around the plan so that we could implement it (or preferrably already have the code in place) if something like this were to happen on mainnet.

**SCENARIO**

Due to a bug in **multiple clients**, the chain has split in two and if the protocol is left unchanged, many many honest validators will get slashed.

**POSSIBLE FIX**

Cut a release that invalidates slashings in this particular block range and coordinate an emergency hard fork. Once forked, tell validators on the wrong chain to reset their slashing DB and join the correct chain.

**RATIONALE**

The whole reason we have slashings is to make the network significantly more expensive to attack than to defend. 
https://medium.com/@VitalikButerin/a-proof-of-stake-design-philosophy-506585978d51

Slashings exist to punish attackers, **not honest validators**. If you think eth devs get hate now.. wait until the community listens to us sit around and debate whether or not to sacrifice them on the alter of ideological purity because of **our mistake**.

author: sproul
content: <@688748669268132001> and I have been thinking about how the mass slashing plays out. We think that if we do a coordinated start of validators, we may finalize quickly before everyone is slashed. Because the number of slashings we can include on chain per slot is quite low. Each slashing needs a pair of attestations from slot 1 (fork day) and slot 2 (now), and it is quite unlikely to have multiple validators with the same slot 1 and slot 2. This is evidenced by the slashings we're seeing on chain recently, which usually only slash 1 or 2 indices. The most we saw was around 100 slashed indices in this block: <https://holesky.beaconcha.in/slot/3726835#attester-slashings>

author: nflaig
content:
Update from Lodestar side, we have fixed a lot of issues and have 10+ nodes synced to head now, still need to activate more validators but seeing blocks and sync committee messages being produced correctly on those that are active and pointed to a synced beacon node.

Summary of improvements
- reduced memory spikes when processing attester slashings
- improved syncing from pre-electra to head, takes "only" around 1h now
- fixed OOM issue due to checkpoint states not being pruned correctly
- still seeing some synced nodes falling out of sync again, needs further investigation

What you need to do if you run Lodestar
- update to new image `ethpandaops/lodestar:holesky-rescue-5cb590f`, or `holesky-rescue` branch if you build from source
- make sure to remove `<dataDir>/chain-db` and `<dataDir>/peerstore` when updating to latest version, while not strictly necessary, it helps to sync faster if your node was stuck previously
- around 10GB memory usage now, although recommendation is to set `--max-old-space-size=32768` (32GB limit) to handle sudden spikes, eg. when slashings start to happen. We have set this limit by default, just make sure you are not overriding it in your setup to a lower value

Let us know if you have any issues
